channel.title: Computer?
channel.description: Well, I'm looking to buy a computer. I don't know what to get. I have limited price range of about 300 to 350 Pounds Sterling. That is about 700 to 750 USD. Any ideas?

item.title: Computer?
item.dc:creator: @Coolnoob55 Coolnoob55
item.description:
@Coolnoob55 wrote:

[quote=“Mr.Chris, post:7, topic:3957”]Can a 14 year old build one :D?

Who knows jack shit about computers[/quote]
Dude when I was 12 I built my first gaming rig and was overclocking

[quote=“Mr.Chris, post:9, topic:3957”]Lol ^^

I think I’ll take the advice to build one as my Brother is studying general computing at Uni. He knows how to build one but I never see him.

So, If I decide to build one, what parts do I get? Where do I get them? How do I know I make the right choice?[/quote]

Building requires a brain, maybe an intermediate experience with computer hardware here are the neccessary components:

A Motherboard
CPU
RAM
(Optional/Recommened for airflow) Case
(Optional unless no onboard video) Video or Graphics Card
Mouse & Keyboard (Unless you have)
Monitor (Unless you have)
Power Supply
Hard Drive
(recommened) Optical Drive
(recommened/optional) OS
(reccommened) Good cooling device such as a good heatsink

And newegg.com is a very good site, FAST Shipping lowest is 3 day shipping

I would also reccommend you to wait till like mid July for the release of Intel’s new “Conroe” processors which own see my post on it against the Overclocked (3.0GHz) AMD-FX62
I think you would have alot of questions on building computers, feel free to post.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer?
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Lol ^^

I think I’ll take the advice to build one as my Brother is studying general computing at Uni. He knows how to build one but I never see him.

So, If I decide to build one, what parts do I get? Where do I get them? How do I know I make the right choice?

Read full topic

item.title: Computer?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

I saw a good 800 dollar one at Best Buys. It had 2.6 or so gigahertz, pentium 4, dell (I’m pretty sure, might have been gateway, and it was definitely not a sony), and about a gig of ram.

The only downside is that I tink it had integrated audio, which sucks. No video card of course, but you can always put one in. And everyone else is right, building one would save you a good 100-200 dollars. It’s not that hard to build. As a kid, you can probably go to best buys, and ask one of the people there about building, or take some online tutorials. I am okay at building, but one time when I spilt coffee all over my motherboard, and got yelled at by my dad, thats when I quit lol.

~Ron

Read full topic

[quote=“Mr.Chris, post:3, topic:3957”]Don’t want to build it -.-

I have no idea on how to build one and can’t be bothered to read up on it frankly -.-[/quote]Ahaha frankly!

Building is usually really easy to do, the hardest part is often choosing what parts to buy.

item.title: Computer?
item.dc:creator: @Coolnoob55 Coolnoob55
item.description:
@Coolnoob55 wrote:

Aww…Come on building one is easy! Just crack open your current case, learn all the crap and build! That’s how I built mine, and building saves you $xxx

http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.asp?Item=N82E16883102664 mm this may suit you…

You should have about 200 or something USD left so then just get another stick of 512mb 184 DDR Ram, An SLI Motherboard, and maybe a lower end 130$ Graphic Card with SLI…Mmm It’s all good
